verses.kjv: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.
verses.ct: After the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome purchased spices so they could go and prepare his body.

verses.kjv: And very early in the morning the first day of the week, they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.
verses.ct: Very early on the first day of the week, just as the sun was coming up, they made their way to the tomb.

verses.kjv: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?
verses.ct: They were asking each other, "Who is going to move that stone away from the entrance of the tomb for us?"

verses.kjv: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.
verses.ct: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone had already been moved — and it was an enormous stone.

verses.kjv: And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.
verses.ct: When they went inside the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a long white robe, sitting on the right side. They were terrified.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Be not affrighted: Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.
verses.ct: He told them, "Don't be afraid. You're looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has risen! He isn't here. Look — this is the spot where they placed him."

verses.kjv: But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.
verses.ct: "Now go and tell his disciples and Peter that he is heading to Galilee ahead of you. You will see him there, just as he told you."

verses.kjv: And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulchre; for they trembled and were amazed: neither said they any thing to any man; for they were afraid.
verses.ct: They rushed out and ran from the tomb, shaking and overwhelmed. They didn't say anything to anyone, because they were too frightened.

verses.kjv: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.
verses.ct: After Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, the woman from whom he had driven out 7 demons.

verses.kjv: And she went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
verses.ct: She went and reported this to those who had been with him, who were grieving and crying.

verses.kjv: And they, when they had heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, believed not.
verses.ct: But when they heard that he was alive and that she had seen him, they refused to believe it.

verses.kjv: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them, as they walked, and went into the country.
verses.ct: After that, he appeared in a different form to 2 of them while they were walking out into the countryside.

verses.kjv: And they went and told it unto the residue: neither believed they them.
verses.ct: They went back and reported it to the rest, but they didn't believe them either.

verses.kjv: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.
verses.ct: Later, he appeared to the 11 disciples while they were eating. He rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Go into the entire world and proclaim the good news to every person."

verses.kjv: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.
verses.ct: "Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned."

verses.kjv: And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;
verses.ct: "These miraculous signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will drive out demons, and they will speak in new languages."

verses.kjv: They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.
verses.ct: "They will pick up snakes, and if they drink anything poisonous, it won't harm them. They will place their hands on sick people, and those people will be healed."

verses.kjv: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.
verses.ct: After the Lord Jesus had finished speaking to them, he was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.

verses.kjv: And they went forth, and preached every where, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word with signs following. Amen.
verses.ct: The disciples went out and spread the message everywhere, while the Lord worked alongside them and confirmed his word through the miraculous signs that accompanied it. Amen.
